content: this hat is more than a pattern it s a journey each crown option carries its own archetypal energy inviting you to choose the story you want to wear at the summit three crowns await the warrior firm and structured armor for clarity the sage balanced and wise harmony in every stitch the muse flowing and dreamlike draped in song and spiral this hat is not one design but many it is a codex of choices a ritual map to cast on is to step into myth to bind off is to claim your crown there are two size options small and large each size gives you three crown options the warrior s crown short beanie option a stand firm in clarity rib converging like armor at the brow… a snug fit crisp and structured for those who walk with strength the sage s crown balanced fit option b wisdom rests in symmetry each stitch a step toward harmony… a classic taper steady and wise for those who honor balance the muse s crown slouchy spiral option c let cables spiral into dream a crown that drapes with grace and song… a flowing silhouette soft and feminine for those who choose inspiration text schematics are as follows **small** *finished measurements* a 9 inches/22 86cm b 9 5 10 inches/24 13-25 4cm c 11 5-12 inches/29 21-30 48cm length 12 inches/30 48cm width laid flat *yardage* approx 60-100 yds/54 86-91 44 meters **large** finished measurements a 9 inches/22 86cm b 9 5 10 inches/24 13-25 4 c 11 5-12 inches/29 21-30 48 length 13 inches/33 02cm width laid flat *yardage* approx 85-140 yds/77 72-128 01 meters yarn suggestions are simply that essentially any super bulky yarn should be just fine in the photos the hunter green hat is worn inside out you should know how to perform a german/old norwegian cast on lc/rc and knit two stitches together sizing is done by changing needle sizes often for optimal fit video link tutorial is included for the suggested cast on method
